Administrator.StudentAttendance(testStudents.get(0), \n                AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.ABSENT));\n            attendances.add(new Administrator.StudentAttendance(testStudents.get(1), \n                AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.PRESENT));\n            \n            List<AbsenceRecord> saved = admin.enterAbsenceData(testDate, attendances, "Test notes");\n            assert saved.size() == 2 : "Should save 2 records";\n            \n            // Test server data sending\n            List<Student> notified = admin.sendDataToServer(testDate);\n            assert notified.size() == 1 : "Should notify 1 absent student\'s parent";\n            \n            // Test log display\n            String log = admin.displayUpdatedLogData(testDate);\n            assert log != null && !log.isEmpty() : "Should return log data";\n            assert log.contains("Absent: 1") : "Log should show 1 absent student";\n            \n            // Test interruption handling\n            admin.interruptOperation();\n            \n            // Test logout\n            admin.logout();\n            assert !admin.isLoggedIn() : "Should not be logged in after logout";\n            \n            System.out.println("  ✓ Administrator class tests passed");\n        } catch (AssertionError e) {\n            System.out.println("  ✗ Administrator class test failed: " + e.getMessage());\n            throw e;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Runs an integration test of multiple components working together.\n     */\n    private static void runIntegrationTest() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== INTEGRATION TEST ===");\n        System.out.println("Testing component integration...");\n        \n        try {\n            // Create components\n            EmailService emailService = new EmailService();\n            Administrator admin = new Administrator("integadmin", "integpass");\n            \n            // Login\n            admin.login("integadmin", "integpass");\n            \n            // Create test data\n            LocalDate testDate = LocalDate.of(2024, 1, 20);\n            List<Student> students = new "integparent2@test.com"));\n            students.add(new Student("I003", "Integration Student 3", "integparent3@test.com"));\n            \n            // Enter attendance data\n            List<Administrator.StudentAttendance> attendances = new ArrayList<>();\n            attendances.add(new Administrator.StudentAttendance(students.get(0), \n                AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.ABSENT));\n            attendances.add(new Administrator.StudentAttendance(students.get(1), \n                AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.PRESENT));\n            attendances.add(new Administrator.StudentAttendance(students.get(2), \n                AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.LATE));\n            \n            List<AbsenceRecord> saved = admin.enterAbsenceData(testDate, attendances, \n                "Integration test notes");\n            \n            assert saved.size() == 3 : "Should save 3 records";\n            \n            // Send to server\n            List<Student> notified = admin.sendDataToServer(testDate);\n            assert notified.size() == 1 : "Should notify 1 absent student";\n            \n            // Verify email service was used\n            String log = admin.displayUpdatedLogData(testDate);\n            assert log.contains("Absent: 1") : "Should show 1 absent in log";\n            assert log.contains("Present: 1") : "Should show 1 present in log";\n            assert log.contains("Late: 1") : "Should show 1 late in log";\n            \n            admin.logout();\n            \n composition, sending, and logging of notifications.\n * In a production system, this would integrate with a real email server (like SMOS or SMTP).\n */\npublic class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends an absence notification email to a student\'s parent.\n     * This is a simulation that logs the email details instead of actually sending.\n     * \n     * @param student The student who is absent\n     * @param date The date of absence\n     * @param notes Optional notes about the absence (can be null)\n     * @return true if the email was successfully "sent", false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean sendAbsenceNotification(Student student, String date, String notes) {\n        if (student == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: student is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null || date.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: date is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String parentEmail = student.getParentEmail();\n        if (parentEmail == null || parentEmail.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: parent email is null or empty for student " + student.getId());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n Notification for " + student.getName();\n            StringBuilder emailBody = new StringBuilder();\n            emailBody.append("Dear Parent/Guardian,\\n\\n");\n            emailBody.append("This is to inform you that ");\n            emailBody.append(student.getName());\n            emailBody.append(" was absent on ");\n            emailBody.append(date);\n            emailBody.append(".\\n");\n            \n            if (notes != null && !notes.trim().isEmpty()) {\n                emailBody.append("Notes: ");\n                emailBody.append(notes.trim());\n                emailBody.append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            emailBody.append("\\nStudent ID: ");\n            emailBody.append(student.getId());\n            emailBody.append("\\n\\nPlease contact the school if you have any questions.\\n");\n            emailBody.append("Sincerely,\\nSchool Administration");\n            \n            // Simulate email sending process\n            LOGGER.info("Sending absence notification email...");\n            LOGGER.info("To: " + parentEmail);\n            LOGGER.info("Subject: " + emailSubject);\n            LOGGER.info("Body:\\n" + emailBody.toString());\n            \n            // Simulate various network/server conditions\n            boolean serverAvailable = isServerAvailable();\n            if (!serverAvailable) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Email server (SMOS) is currently unavailable. Email queued for retry.");\n                // In a real system, this would queue the email for later sending\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Simulate email transmission\n            Thread.sleep(100); // Simulate network delay\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Absence notification email successfully sent to " + parentEmail);\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending was interrupted: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt(); // Restore interrupt status\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to send email: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends absence notifications for multiple absence records.\n     * \n     * @param absenceRecords List of absence records to send notifications for\n     * @return List of students for whom emails were successfully sent\n     */\n    public List<Student> sendBulkAbsenceNotifications(List<AbsenceRecord> absenceRecords) {\n        List<Student> successfulNotifications = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        if (absenceRecords == null || absenceRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absence records to process");\n            return successfulNotifications;\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Starting bulk email notification for " + absenceRecords.size() + " absence records");\n        \n        for (AbsenceRecord record : absenceRecords) {\n            // Only send notifications for actual absences (not for present or late students)\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                String notes = record.getNotes();\n                boolean sent = sendAbsenceNotification(record.getStudent(), \n                                                      record.getDate().toString(), \n                                                      notes);\n                if (sent) {\n                    successfulNotifications.add(record.getStudent());\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Bulk email notification completed. " + \n                   successfulNotifications.size() + "/" + absenceRecords.size() + \n                   " emails sent successfully");\n        return successfulNotifications;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the email server is available.\n     * This is a simulation - in real implementation, would ping the SMOS server.\n     * \n     * @return true if server is available, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isServerAvailable() {\n        // Simulate server availability - 90% chance of being available\n        // In a real system, this would attempt to connect to the SMOS server\n        return Math.random() > 0.1;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates connecting to the SMOS email server.\n     * This method would establish a connection in a real implementation.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean connectToSmoSServer() {\n        LOGGER.info("Attempting to connect to SMOS server...");\n        \n        try {\n            // Simulate connection attempt\n            Thread.sleep(200);\n            \n            boolean connected = isServerAvailable();\n            if (connected) {\n                LOGGER.info("Successfully connected to SMOS server");\n            } else {\n                LOGGER.warning("Failed to connect to SMOS server. Server may be down or unreachable.");\n            }\n            \n            return connected;\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Connection to SMOS server was interrupted");\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Error connecting to SMOS server: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates disconnecting from the SMOS email server.\n     */\n    public void disconnectFromSmoSServer() {\n        LOGGER.info("Disconnecting from SMOS server...");\n        // In a real system, this would close the connection\n        LOGGER.info("Disconnected from SMOS server");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a test email to verify the email service is working.\n     * \n     * @param testEmail The email address to send the test to\n     * @return true if test email was successfully sent, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean sendTestEmail(String testEmail) {\n        if (testEmail == null || testEmail.trim().isEmpty() || !testEmail.contains("@")) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Invalid test email address: " + testEmail);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending test email to: " + testEmail);\n        \n        try {\n            // Simulate test email sending\n            Thread.sleep(50);\n            LOGGER.info("Test email successfully sent to " + testEmail);\n            return true;\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Test email sending was interrupted");\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to send test email: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an email address format.\n     * Note: This is a basic validation. In production, use a comprehensive email validator.\n     * \n     * @param email The email address to validate\n     * @return true if email format is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean isValidEmailFormat(String email) {\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String trimmedEmail = email.trim();\n        \n        // Basic email format validation\n        return trimmedEmail.contains("@") && \n               trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") > 0 && \n               trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") < trimmedEmail.length() - 1 &&\n               trimmedEmail.contains(".") &&\n               trimmedEmail.indexOf(".") > trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") + 1;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'The EmailService class has been successfully created. LOGGER.info("Administrator " + username + " logged in successfully");\n            \n            // Attempt to connect to SMOS server upon successful login\n            boolean serverConnected = emailService.connectToSmoSServer();\n            if (!serverConnected) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Login successful but could not connect to SMOS server");\n                // Continue anyway - emails will be queued or retried\n            }\n            \n            return true;\n        } else {\n            LOGGER.warning("Login failed for username: " + inputUsername);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the administrator and disconnects from the SMOS server.\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        if (isLoggedIn) {\n            LOGGER.info("Logging out administrator: " + username);\n            emailService.disconnectFromSmoSServer();\n            isLoggedIn = false;\n            LOGGER.info("Administrator " + username + " logged out successfully");\n        } else {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot logout: administrator is not logged in");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the administrator is currently logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates the screen display according to the selected date.\n     * This simulates retrieving and displaying absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display records for\n     * @return List of absence records for the specified date, or empty list if none\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> updateScreenForDate(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to update screen");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot update screen: date is null");\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Updating screen for date: " + date);\n        \n        // Retrieve existing records for this date\n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>());\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Found " + records.size() + " absence records for " + date);\n        \n        // In a real system, this would update the UI screen\n        // For simulation, we just return the records\n        return new ArrayList<>(records); // Return a copy to prevent modification\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Enters absence data for multiple students on a specific date.\n     * This simulates filling out the form and clicking "Save".\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the absence records\n     * @param studentRecords List of students with their attendance status\n     * @param notes Optional notes for the absence records (applied to all)\n     * @return List of created absence records\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if date or studentRecords is null\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> enterAbsenceData(LocalDate date, \n                                                List<StudentAttendance> studentRecords, \n                                                String notes) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to enter absence data");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Date cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        if (studentRecords == null || studentRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("No student records provided for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Entering absence data for " + studentRecords.size() + \n                   " students on date: " + date);\n        \n        List<AbsenceRecord> newRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        String processedNotes = (notes == null) ? "" : notes.trim();\n        \n        for (StudentAttendance studentAttendance : studentRecords) {\n            if (studentAttendance == null || studentAttendance.getStudent() == null) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Skipping invalid student attendance record");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            Student student = studentAttendance.getStudent();\n            AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status = studentAttendance.getStatus();\n            \n            // Create absence record\n            AbsenceRecord record = new AbsenceRecord(date, student, status, processedNotes);\n            newRecords.add(record);\n            \n            LOGGER.fine("Created record: " + record.toSummaryString());\n        }\n        \n        // Store the records\n        storeAbsenceRecords(date, newRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Successfully entered " + newRecords.size() + \n                   " absence records for date: " + date);\n        \n        return newRecords;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends absence data to server and triggers email notifications for absent students.\n     * This simulates the server processing and email sending.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the absence records to send\n     * @return List of students for whom notifications were successfully sent\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public List<Student> sendDataToServer(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to send data to server");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send data to server: date is null");\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending absence data to server for date: " + date);\n        \n        // Get absence records for the specified date\n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.get(date);\n        if (records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absence records found for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        // Filter for absent students only\n        List<AbsenceRecord> absentRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (AbsenceRecord record : records) {\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                absentRecords.add(record);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (absentRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absent students found for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending notifications for " + absentRecords.size() + " absent students");\n        \n        // Use EmailService to send notifications\n        List<Student> notifiedStudents = emailService.sendBulkAbsenceNotifications(absentRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Email notifications sent to " + notifiedStudents.size() + \n                   " parents for date: " + date);\n        \n        return notifiedStudents;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays updated log data after processing.\n     * This simulates refreshing the display with updated information.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display log data for\n     * @return Formatted log data as a string\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public String displayUpdatedLogData(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to display log data");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            return "Error: Date is null";\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Displaying updated log data for date: " + date);\n        \n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.get(date);\n        if (records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            return "No absence records found for " + date;\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder logData = new StringBuilder();\n        logData.append("=== ABSENCE LOG FOR ").append(date).append(" ===\\n");\n        logData.append("Total records: ").append(records.size()).append("\\n\\n");\n        \n        int absentCount = 0;\n        int presentCount = 0;\n        int lateCount = 0;\n        \n        for (AbsenceRecord record : records) {\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                absentCount++;\n            } else if (record.isPresent()) {\n                presentCount++;\n            } else if (record.isLate()) {\n                lateCount++;\n            }\n            \n            logData.append(record.toSummaryString()).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        logData.append("\\n=== SUMMARY ===\\n");\n        logData.append("Present: ").append(presentCount).append("\\n");\n        logData.append("Absent: ").append(absentCount).append("\\n");\n        logData.append("Late: ").append(lateCount).append("\\n");\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Log data displayed for " + records.size() + " records");\n        \n        return logData.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Interrupts the current operation and handles connection to SMOS server.\n     * This simulates the administrator interrupting the operation.\n     */\n    public void interruptOperation() {\n        LOGGER.warning("Administrator " + username + " interrupted the operation");\n        \n        // Handle interrupted SMOS server connection\n        if (isLoggedIn) {\n            LOGGER.info("Checking SMOS server connection status...");\n            boolean reconnected = emailService.connectToSmoSServer();\n            if (reconnected) {\n                LOGGER.info("Successfully reconnected to SMOS server after interruption");\n            } else {\n                LOGGER.warning("Could not reconnect to SMOS server. Emails may be queued.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // In a real system, this would handle rollback or save state\n        LOGGER.info("Operation interrupted. System remains on registry screen.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the username of the administrator.\n     * \n     * @return The administrator username\n     */\n    public String getUsername() {\n        return username;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the email service instance used by this administrator.\n     * \n     * @return The EmailService instance\n     */\n    public EmailService getEmailService() {\n        return emailService;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to retrieve records for\n     * @return List of absence records for the date, or empty list if none\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> getAbsenceRecordsForDate(LocalDate date) {\n        if (date == null) {\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        return new ArrayList<>(absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>()));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all absence records across all dates.\n     * \n     * @return List of all absence records\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> getAllAbsenceRecords() {\n        List<AbsenceRecord> allRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (List<AbsenceRecord> records : absenceRecordsByDate.values()) {\n            allRecords.addAll(records);\n        }\n        return allRecords;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all absence records (for testing/reset purposes).\n     */\n    public void clearAllRecords() {\n        LOGGER.info("Clearing all absence records");\n        absenceRecordsByDate.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Stores absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the records\n     * @param records The records to store\n     */\n    private void storeAbsenceRecords(LocalDate date, List<AbsenceRecord> records) {\n        if (date == null || records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Get existing records for this date or create new list\n        List<AbsenceRecord> existingRecords = absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>());\n        \n        // Remove any existing records for the same students (update in place)\n        for (AbsenceRecord newRecord : records) {\n            // Remove existing record for this student if present\n            existingRecords.removeIf(record -> \n                record.getStudent().getId().equals(newRecord.getStudent().getId()));\n            \n            // Add the new record\n            existingRecords.add(newRecord);\n        }\n        \n        // Store back in map\n        absenceRecordsByDate.put(date, existingRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Stored " + records.size() + " records for date: " + date);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class representing a student\'s attendance status for data entry.\n     * This is used when entering absence data through the form.\n     */\n    public static class StudentAttendance {\n        private Student student;\n        private AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status;\n        \n        /**\n         * Constructor for StudentAttendance.\n         * \n         * @param student The student\n         * @param status The attendance status\n         */\n        public StudentAttendance(Student student, AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status) {\n            if (student == null) {\n                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student cannot be null");\n            }\n            if (status == null) {\n                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Attendance status cannot be null");\n            }\n            \n            this.student = student;\n            this.status = status;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Gets the student.\n         * \n         * @return The student\n         */\n        public Student getStudent() {\n            return student;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Gets the attendance status.\n         * \n         * @return The attendance status\n         */\n        public AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus getStatus() {\n            return status;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Sets the attendance status.\n         * \n         * @param status The new attendance status\n         */\n        public void setStatus(AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status) {\n            if (status == null) {\n                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Attendance status cannot be null");\n            }\n            this.status = status;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String toString() {\n            return "StudentAttendance[Student: " + student.getName() + \n                   ", Status: " + status.getDisplayName() + "]";\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'The Administrator class has been successfully created (it was generated by This class demonstrates all steps from\n * login to data entry and email notification.\n * \n * The system follows this sequence:\n * 1. Administrator logs in\n * 2. Selects a date (screen updates accordingly)\n * 3. Fills out form with absent/present students and saves\n * 4. Sends data to server (triggers email notifications)\n * 5. Displays updated log data\n * 6. Handles operation interruption and SMOS server reconnection\n */\npublic class EnterAbsencesAdminSystem {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EnterAbsencesAdminSystem.class.getName());\n    \n    private Administrator admin;\n    private List<Student> sampleStudents;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor initializes the system with sample data.\n     */\n    public EnterAbsencesAdminSystem() {\n        // Initialize scanner for user input\n        scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n        \n        // Create sample students for demonstration\n        initializeSampleStudents();\n        \n        // Create administrator with credentials\n        admin = new Administrator("admin", "password123");\n        \n        LOGGER.info("EnterAbsencesAdminSystem initialized");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Initializes sample student data for demonstration.\n     */\n    private void initializeSampleStudents() {\n        sampleStudents = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        // Create sample students with realistic data\n        sampleStudents.add(new Student("S001", "John Smith", "parent.smith@example.com"));\n        sampleStudents.add(new Student("S002", "Emma Johnson", "emma.parent@example.com"));\n        sampleStudents.add(new Student("S003", "Michael Brown", "mbrown.parent@example.com"));\n        sampleStudents.add(new Student("S004", "Sarah Davis", "sdavis.parent@example.com"));\n        sampleStudents.add(new Student("S005", "James Wilson", "jwilson.parent@example.com"));\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Initialized " + sampleStudents.size() + " sample students");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method - entry point of the application.\n     * \n     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        // Configure logging level\n        Logger.getLogger("").setLevel(Level.INFO);\n        \n        LOGGER.info("=== EnterAbsencesAdmin System Starting ===");\n        \n        // Create and run the system\n        EnterAbsencesAdminSystem system = new EnterAbsencesAdminSystem();\n        system.run();\n        \n        LOGGER.info("=== EnterAbsencesAdmin System Completed ===");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main execution flow of the system.\n     * Follows the use case sequence step by step.\n     */\n    public void run() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Welcome to EnterAbsencesAdmin System ===\\n");\n        \n        // Step 0: Administrator login (precondition)\n        if (!performLogin()) {\n            System.out.println("Login failed. Exiting system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Administrator selects date\n        LocalDate selectedDate = selectDate();\n        if (selectedDate == null) {\n            System.out.println("Date selection cancelled. Exiting system.");\n            admin.logout();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Update screen displayed according to the date\n        updateScreenForDate(selectedDate);\n        \n        // Step 3: Fill out form with absent/present students and save\n        List<Administrator.StudentAttendance> attendanceRecords = fillOutForm(selectedDate);\n        if (attendanceRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No attendance data entered. Operation cancelled.");\n            admin.logout();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Save the data\n        List<AbsenceRecord> savedRecords = saveAttendanceData(selectedDate, attendanceRecords);\n        if (savedRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Failed to save attendance data.");\n            admin.logout();\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 4: Send data to server (triggers email notifications)\n        List<Student> notifiedStudents = sendDataToServer(selectedDate);\n        \n        // Step 5: Display updated log data\n        displayUpdatedLogData(selectedDate);\n        \n        // Step 6: Demonstrate interruption handling (simulated)\n        simulateInterruption();\n        \n        // Logout and clean up\n        admin.logout();\n        scanner.close();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=== Operation Completed Successfully ===");\n        System.out.println("Summary:");\n        System.out.println("- Date: " + selectedDate);\n        System.out.println("- Students processed: " + savedRecords.size());\n        System.out.println("- Parents notified: " + notifiedStudents.size());\n        System.out.println("- System remains on registry screen (simulated)");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs administrator login.\n     * \n     * @return true if login successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performLogin() {\n        System.out.println("=== Administrator Login ===");\n        \n        System.out.print("Username: ");\n        String username = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        System.out.print("Password: ");\n        String password = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        boolean loginSuccess = admin.login(username, password);\n        \n        if (loginSuccess) {\n            System.out.println("✓ Login successful! Welcome, " + username + ".");\n            return true;\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("✗ Login failed. Invalid credentials.");\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Prompts administrator to select a date.\n     * \n     * @return Selected LocalDate, or null if cancelled\n     */\n    private LocalDate selectDate() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Date Selection ===");\n        System.out.println("Enter date for attendance records (YYYY-MM-DD):");\n        System.out.println("Press Enter for today\'s date, or type \'cancel\' to exit.");\n        \n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("cancel")) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        LocalDate selectedDate;\n        if (input.isEmpty()) {\n            selectedDate = LocalDate.now();\n            System.out.println("Using today\'s date: " + selectedDate);\n        } else {\n            try {\n                selectedDate = LocalDate.parse(input);\n                System.out.println("Selected date: " + selectedDate);\n            } catch (Exception e) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD.");\n                System.out.println("Using today\'s date instead: " + LocalDate.now());\n                selectedDate = LocalDate.now();\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Validate date is not in the future\n        if (selectedDate.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: Selected date is in the future.");\n            System.out.print("Continue anyway? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!confirm.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n                return selectDate(); // Recursive call to select again\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return selectedDate;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates screen display according to the selected date.\n     * Shows existing records for that date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display records for\n     */\n    private void updateScreenForDate(LocalDate date) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Updating Screen for " + date + " ===");\n        \n        try {\n            List<AbsenceRecord> existingRecords = admin.updateScreenForDate(date);\n            \n            if (existingRecords.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("No existing attendance records found for " + date);\n                System.out.println("Screen shows empty attendance form.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Found " + existingRecords.size() + " existing records:");\n                for (AbsenceRecord record : existingRecords) {\n                    System.out.println("  - " + record.toSummaryString());\n                }\n                System.out.println("Screen updated with existing data.");\n            }\n            \n            System.out.println("✓ Screen update completed.");\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            throw e; // Re-throw as this is a critical error\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates filling out the attendance form.\n     * Administrator marks each student as present, absent, or late.\n     * \n     * @param date The date for the attendance records\n     * @return List of StudentAttendance records\n     */\n    private List<Administrator.StudentAttendance> fillOutForm(LocalDate date) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Filling Out Attendance Form ===");\n        System.out.println("Mark attendance for each student on " + date);\n        System.out.println("Options: P=Present, A=Absent, L=Late, S=Skip");\n        \n        List<Administrator.StudentAttendance> attendanceRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (Student student : sampleStudents) {\n            System.out.println("\\nStudent: " + student.getName() + " (ID: " + student.getId() + ")");\n            System.out.print("Attendance [P/A/L/S]: ");\n            \n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toUpperCase();\n            \n            if (input.equals("S")) {\n                System.out.println("Skipping this student.");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status;\n            switch (input) {\n                case "P":\n                    status = AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.PRESENT;\n                    System.out.println("Marked as Present");\n                    break;\n                case "A":\n                    status = AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.ABSENT;\n                    System.out.println("Marked as Absent");\n                    break;\n                case "L":\n                    status = AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.LATE;\n                    System.out.println("Marked as Late");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid input. Defaulting to Present.");\n                    status = AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus.PRESENT;\n                    break;\n            }\n            \n            attendanceRecords.add(new Administrator.StudentAttendance(student, status));\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nForm completed for " + attendanceRecords.size() + " students.");\n        return attendanceRecords;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves the attendance data entered in the form.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of attendance\n     * @param attendanceRecords The attendance data to save\n     * @return List of saved AbsenceRecord objects\n     */\n    private List<AbsenceRecord> saveAttendanceData(LocalDate date, \n                                                   List<Administrator.StudentAttendance> attendanceRecords) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Saving Attendance Data ===");\n        \n        System.out.print("Add optional notes for all records (or press Enter for none): ");\n        String notes = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (!notes.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Notes added: " + notes);\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            List<AbsenceRecord> savedRecords = admin.enterAbsenceData(date, attendanceRecords, notes);\n            \n            if (savedRecords.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("✗ No records were saved.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("✓ Successfully saved " + savedRecords.size() + " attendance records.");\n                \n                // Count by status\n                int presentCount = 0, absentCount = 0, lateCount = 0;\n                for (AbsenceRecord record : savedRecords) {\n                    if (record.isPresent()) presentCount++;\n                    if (record.isAbsent()) absentCount++;\n                    if (record.isLate()) lateCount++;\n                }\n                \n                System.out.println("  - Present: " + presentCount);\n                System.out.println("  - Absent: " + absentCount);\n                System.out.println("  - Late: " + lateCount);\n            }\n            \n            return savedRecords;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("✗ Error saving attendance data: " + e.getMessage());\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to save attendance data", e);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends data to server and triggers email notifications for absent students.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of records to send\n     * @return List of students whose parents were notified\n     */\n    private List<Student> sendDataToServer(LocalDate date) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Sending Data to Server ===");\n        System.out.println("Sending attendance data for " + date + " to server...");\n        System.out.println("This will trigger email notifications to parents of absent students.");\n        \n        System.out.print("Confirm send? (yes/no): ");\n        String confirm = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (!confirm.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n            System.out.println("Data sending cancelled.");\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            List<Student> notifiedStudents = admin.sendDataToServer(date);\n            \n            if (notifiedStudents.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Data sent to server successfully.");\n                System.out.println("  No absent students found, so no emails were sent.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("✓ Data sent to server successfully.");\n                System.out.println("  Email notifications sent to " + notifiedStudents.size() + " parents:");\n                \n                for (Student student : notifiedStudents) {\n                    System.out.println("    - " + student.getName() + "\'s parent at " + student.getParentEmail());\n                }\n            }\n            \n            return notifiedStudents;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("✗ Error sending data to server: " + e.getMessage());\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to send data to server", e);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays updated log data after processing.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display logs for\n     */\n    private void displayUpdatedLogData(LocalDate date) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Updated Log Data ===");\n        \n        try {\n            String logData = admin.displayUpdatedLogData(date);\n            System.out.println(logData);\n            System.out.println("✓ Log data displayed successfully.");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("✗ Error displaying log data: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates an operation interruption and SMOS server reconnection.\n     * Demonstrates the system\'s ability to handle interruptions gracefully.\n     */\n    private void simulateInterruption() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Simulating Operation Interruption ===");\n        System.out.println("(This demonstrates interruption handling as per use case postconditions)");\n        \n        System.out.print("Simulate interruption? (yes/no): ");\n        String simulate = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (simulate.equalsIgnoreCase("yes")) {\n            System.out.println("Simulating administrator interruption...");\n            \n            // Simulate interruption\n            admin.interruptOperation();\n            \n            System.out.println("✓ Interruption handled.");\n            System.out.println("  - System remains on registry screen");\n            System.out.println("  - Connection to SMOS server checked/re-established");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Interruption simulation skipped.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the administrator instance (for testing purposes).\n     * \n     * @return The Administrator instance\n     */\n    public Administrator getAdmin() {\n        return admin;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the sample students (for testing purposes).\n     * \n     * @return List of sample students\n     */\n    public List<Student> getSampleStudents() {\n        return new ArrayList<>(sampleStudents);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'The EnterAbsencesAdminSystem main class has been successfully created. Update the screen displayed according to the date.\n2. Fill out the form by entering absent students / present and click "Save".\n3. Send data to the server. 001|I'll create a comprehensive test class that demonstrates the EnterAbsencesAdmin system functionality. This test class will include unit tests for individual components and a demonstration of the complete use case flow.
002|
003|```
004|import java.time.LocalDate;
005|import java.util.ArrayList;
006|import java.util.List;
007|import java.util.logging.Level;
008|import java.util.logging.Logger;
009|
010|/**
011| * EnterAbsencesAdminTest - Test class for the EnterAbsencesAdmin system.
012| * This class demonstrates the functionality with a predefined scenario and includes
013| * unit tests for individual components.
014| * 
015| * Features demonstrated:
016| * 1. Unit tests for Student, AbsenceRecord, EmailService, and Administrator classes
017| * 2. Complete use case flow simulation
018| * 3. Edge case handling demonstration
019| * 4. Error scenario simulation
020| */
021|public class EnterAbsencesAdminTest {
022|    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EnterAbsencesAdminTest.class.getName());
023|    
024|    /**
025|     * Main method to run all tests and demonstrations.
026|     * 
027|     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
028|     */
029|    public static void main(String[] args) {
030|        // Configure logging
031|        Logger.getLogger("").setLevel(Level.INFO);
032|        
033|        System.out.println("=== EnterAbsencesAdmin System Tests ===\n");
034|        
035|        // Run unit tests
036|        runUnitTests();
037|        
038|        // Run integration test
039|        runIntegrationTest();
040|        
041|        // Run error scenario test
042|        runErrorScenarioTest();
043|        
044|        // Run complete use case demonstration
045|        runCompleteUseCaseDemo();
046|        
047|        System.out.println("\n=== All Tests Completed Successfully ===");
048|    }
049|    
050|    /**
051|     * Runs unit tests for individual components.
052|     */
053|    private static void runUnitTests() {
054|        System.out.println("=== UNIT TESTS ===");
055|        
056|        // Test Student class
057|        testStudentClass();
058|        
059|        // Test AbsenceRecord class
060|        testAbsenceRecordClass();
061|        
062|        // Test EmailService class
063|        testEmailServiceClass();
064|        
065|        // Test Administrator class
066|        testAdministratorClass();
067|        
068|        System.out.println("✓ All unit tests passed\n");
069|    }
070|    
071|    /**
072|     * Tests the Student class functionality.
073|     */
074|    private static void testStudentClass() {
075|        System.out.println("Testing Student class...");
076|        
077|        try {
078|            // Test constructor and getters
079|            Student student = new Student("T001", "Test Student", "parent@test.com", false);
080|            assert "T001".equals(student.getId()) : "Student ID mismatch";
081|            assert "Test Student".equals(student.getName()) : "Student name mismatch";
082|            assert "parent@test.com".equals(student.getParentEmail()) : "Parent email mismatch";
083|            assert !student.isAbsent() : "Student should not be absent initially";
084|            
085|            // Test setters
086|            student.setName("Updated Name");
087|            assert "Updated Name".equals(student.getName()) : "Name update failed";
088|            
089|            student.setParentEmail("newparent@test.com");
090|            assert "newparent@test.com".equals(student.getParentEmail()) : "Email update failed";
091|            
092|            // Test absence marking
093|            student.markAbsent();
094|            assert student.isAbsent() : "Student should be marked absent";
095|            
096|            student.markPresent();
097|            assert !student.isAbsent() : "Student should be marked present";
098|            
099|            // Test validation
100|            boolean validationError = false;

001|I'll create a comprehensive test class that demonstrates the EnterAbsencesAdmin system functionality. This test class will include unit tests for individual components and a demonstration of the complete use case flow.
002|
003|```
004|import java.time.LocalDate;
005|import java.util.ArrayList;
006|import java.util.List;
007|import java.util.logging.Level;
008|import java.util.logging.Logger;
009|
010|/**
011| * EnterAbsencesAdminTest - Test class for the EnterAbsencesAdmin system.
012| * This class demonstrates the functionality with a predefined scenario and includes
013| * unit tests for individual components.
014| * 
015| * Features demonstrated:
016| * 1. Unit tests for Student, AbsenceRecord, EmailService, and Administrator classes
017| * 2. Complete use case flow simulation
018| * 3. Edge case handling demonstration
019| * 4. Error scenario simulation
020| */
021|public class EnterAbsencesAdminTest {
022|    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EnterAbsencesAdminTest.class.getName());
023|    
024|    /**
025|     * Main method to run all tests and demonstrations.
026|     * 
027|     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
028|     */
029|    public static void main(String[] args) {
030|        // Configure logging
031|        Logger.getLogger("").setLevel(Level.INFO);
032|        
033|        System.out.println("=== EnterAbsencesAdmin System Tests ===\n");
034|        
035|        // Run unit tests
036|        runUnitTests();
037|        
038|        // Run integration test
039|        runIntegrationTest();
040|        
041|        // Run error scenario test
042|        runErrorScenarioTest();
043|        
044|        // Run complete use case demonstration
045|        runCompleteUseCaseDemo();
046|        
047|        System.out.println("\n=== All Tests Completed Successfully ===");
048|    }
049|    
050|    /**
051|     * Runs unit tests for individual components.
052|     */
053|    private static void runUnitTests() {
054|        System.out.println("=== UNIT TESTS ===");
055|        
056|        // Test Student class
057|        testStudentClass();
058|        
059|        // Test AbsenceRecord class
060|        testAbsenceRecordClass();
061|        
062|        // Test EmailService class
063|        testEmailServiceClass();
064|        
065|        // Test Administrator class
066|        testAdministratorClass();
067|        
068|        System.out.println("✓ All unit tests passed\n");
069|    }
070|    
071|    /**
072|     * Tests the Student class functionality.
073|     */
074|    private static void testStudentClass() {
075|        System.out.println("Testing Student class...");
076|        
077|        try {
078|            // Test constructor and getters
079|            Student student = new Student("T001", "Test Student", "parent@test.com", false);
080|            assert "T001".equals(student.getId()) : "Student ID mismatch";
081|            assert "Test Student".equals(student.getName()) : "Student name mismatch";
082|            assert "parent@test.com".equals(student.getParentEmail()) : "Parent email mismatch";
083|            assert !student.isAbsent() : "Student should not be absent initially";
084|            
085|            // Test setters
086|            student.setName("Updated Name");
087|            assert "Updated Name".equals(student.getName()) : "Name update failed";
088|            
089|            student.setParentEmail("newparent@test.com");
090|            assert "newparent@test.com".equals(student.getParentEmail()) : "Email update failed";
091|            
092|            // Test absence marking
093|            student.markAbsent();
094|            assert student.isAbsent() : "Student should be marked absent";
095|            
096|            student.markPresent();
097|            assert !student.isAbsent() : "Student should be marked present";
098|            
099|            // Test validation
100|            boolean validationError = false;

AbsenceRecord class representing an absence record for a student on a specific date.\n * Tracks whether the student was absent, present, or late.\n * This class is immutable to ensure data integrity.\n */\npublic class AbsenceRecord {\n    /**\n     * Enum representing the possible attendance statuses.\n     */\n    public enum AttendanceStatus {\n        PRESENT("Present"),\n        ABSENT("Absent"),\n        LATE("Late");\n        \n        private final String displayName;\n        \n        AttendanceStatus(String displayName) {\n            this.displayName = displayName;\n        }\n        \n        public String getDisplayName() {\n            return displayName;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    private final LocalDate date;\n    private final Student student;\n    private java.util.logging.Level;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * EmailService class that simulates sending email notifications to parents for student absences.\n * This service handles email composition, sending, and logging of notifications.\n * In a production system, this would integrate with a real email server (like SMOS or SMTP).\n */\npublic class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends an absence notification email to a student\'s parent.\n     * This is a simulation that logs the email details instead of actually sending.\n     * \n     * @param student The student who is absent\n     * @param date The date of absence\n     * @param notes Optional notes about the absence (can be null)\n     * @return true if the email was successfully "sent", false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean sendAbsenceNotification(Student student, String date, String notes) {\n        if (student == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: student is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null || date.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: date is null or empty");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String parentEmail = student.getParentEmail();\n        if (parentEmail == null || parentEmail.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send email: parent email is null or empty for student " + student.getId());\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // In a real system, this would connect to an email server (SMOS/SMTP)\n            // For simulation purposes, we log the email details\n            String emailSubject = "Absence Notification for " + student.getName();\n            StringBuilder emailBody = new StringBuilder();\n            emailBody.append("Dear Parent/Guardian,\\n\\n");\n            emailBody.append("This is to inform you that ");\n            emailBody.append(student.getName());\n            emailBody.append(" was absent on ");\n            emailBody.append(date);\n            emailBody.append(".\\n");\n            \n            if (notes != null && !notes.trim().isEmpty()) {\n                emailBody.append("Notes: ");\n                emailBody.append(notes.trim());\n                emailBody.append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            emailBody.append("\\nStudent ID: ");\n            emailBody.append(student.getId());\n            emailBody.append("\\n\\nPlease contact the school if you have any questions.\\n");\n            emailBody.append("Sincerely,\\nSchool Administration");\n            \n            // Simulate email sending process\n            LOGGER.info("Sending absence notification email...");\n            LOGGER.info("To: " + parentEmail);\n            LOGGER.info("Subject: " + emailSubject);\n            LOGGER.info("Body:\\n" + emailBody.toString());\n            \n            // Simulate various network/server conditions\n            boolean serverAvailable = isServerAvailable();\n            if (!serverAvailable) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Email server (SMOS) is currently unavailable. Email queued for retry.");\n                // In a real system, this would queue the email for later sending\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Simulate email transmission\n            Thread.sleep(100); // Simulate network delay\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Absence notification email successfully sent to " + parentEmail);\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending was interrupted: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt(); // Restore interrupt status\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to send email: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends absence notifications for multiple absence records.\n     * \n     * @param absenceRecords List of absence records to send notifications for\n     * @return List of students for whom emails were successfully sent\n     */\n    public List<Student> sendBulkAbsenceNotifications(List<AbsenceRecord> absenceRecords) {\n        List<Student> successfulNotifications = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        if (absenceRecords == null || absenceRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absence records to process");\n            return successfulNotifications;\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Starting bulk email notification for " + absenceRecords.size() + " absence records");\n        \n        for (AbsenceRecord record : absenceRecords) {\n            // Only send notifications for actual absences (not for present or late students)\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                String notes = record.getNotes();\n                boolean sent = sendAbsenceNotification(record.getStudent(), \n                                                      record.getDate().toString(), \n                                                      notes);\n                if (sent) {\n                    successfulNotifications.add(record.getStudent());\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Bulk email notification completed. " + \n                   successfulNotifications.size() + "/" + absenceRecords.size() + \n                   " emails sent successfully");\n        return successfulNotifications;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the email server is available.\n     * This is a simulation - in real implementation, would ping the SMOS server.\n     * \n     * @return true if server is available, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isServerAvailable() {\n        // Simulate server availability - 90% chance of being available\n        // In a real system, this would attempt to connect to the SMOS server\n        return Math.random() > 0.1;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates connecting to the SMOS email server.\n     * This method would establish a connection in a real implementation.\n     * \n     * @return true if connection successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean connectToSmoSServer() {\n        LOGGER.info("Attempting to connect to SMOS server...");\n        \n        try {\n            // Simulate connection attempt\n            Thread.sleep(200);\n            \n            boolean connected = isServerAvailable();\n            if (connected) {\n                LOGGER.info("Successfully connected to SMOS server");\n            } else {\n                LOGGER.warning("Failed to connect to SMOS server. Server may be down or unreachable.");\n            }\n            \n            return connected;\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Connection to SMOS server was interrupted");\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Error connecting to SMOS server: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates disconnecting from the SMOS email server.\n     */\n    public void disconnectFromSmoSServer() {\n        LOGGER.info("Disconnecting from SMOS server...");\n        // In a real system, this would close the connection\n        LOGGER.info("Disconnected from SMOS server");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a test email to verify the email service is working.\n     * \n     * @param testEmail The email address to send the test to\n     * @return true if test email was successfully sent, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean sendTestEmail(String testEmail) {\n        if (testEmail == null || testEmail.trim().isEmpty() || !testEmail.contains("@")) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Invalid test email address: " + testEmail);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending test email to: " + testEmail);\n        \n        try {\n            // Simulate test email sending\n            Thread.sleep(50);\n            LOGGER.info("Test email successfully sent to " + testEmail);\n            return true;\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Test email sending was interrupted");\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Failed to send test email: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an email address format.\n     * Note: This is a basic validation. In production, use a comprehensive email validator.\n     * \n     * @param email The email address to validate\n     * @return true if email format is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public static boolean isValidEmailFormat(String email) {\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        String trimmedEmail = email.trim();\n        \n        // Basic email format validation\n        return trimmedEmail.contains("@") && \n               trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") > 0 && \n               trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") < trimmedEmail.length() - 1 &&\n               trimmedEmail.contains(".") &&\n               trimmedEmail.indexOf(".") > trimmedEmail.indexOf("@") + 1;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'The EmailService class has been successfully created. Administrator with credentials.\n     * \n     * @param username Administrator username\n     * @param password Administrator password\n     */\n    public Administrator(String username, String password) {\n        this.username = username;\n        this.password = password;\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        this.emailService = new EmailService();\n        this.absenceRecordsByDate = new HashMap<>();\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Administrator object created for user: " + username);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Attempts to log in the administrator with provided credentials.\n     * \n     * @param inputUsername The username to check\n     * @param inputPassword The password to check\n     * @return true if login successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean login(String inputUsername, String inputPassword) {\n        if (inputUsername == null || inputPassword == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Login failed: username or password is null");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // In a real system, this would validate against a database or authentication service\n        boolean credentialsValid = this.username.equals(inputUsername) && \n                                   this.password.equals(inputPassword);\n        \n        if (credentialsValid) {\n            isLoggedIn = true;\n            LOGGER.info("Administrator " + username + " logged in successfully");\n            \n            // Attempt to connect to SMOS server upon successful login\n            boolean serverConnected = emailService.connectToSmoSServer();\n            if (!serverConnected) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Login successful but could not connect to SMOS server");\n                // Continue anyway - emails will be queued or retried\n            }\n            \n            return true;\n        } else {\n            LOGGER.warning("Login failed for username: " + inputUsername);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the administrator and disconnects from the SMOS server.\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        if (isLoggedIn) {\n            LOGGER.info("Logging out administrator: " + username);\n            emailService.disconnectFromSmoSServer();\n            isLoggedIn = false;\n            LOGGER.info("Administrator " + username + " logged out successfully");\n        } else {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot logout: administrator is not logged in");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if the administrator is currently logged in.\n     * \n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates the screen display according to the selected date.\n     * This simulates retrieving and displaying absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display records for\n     * @return List of absence records for the specified date, or empty list if none\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> updateScreenForDate(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to update screen");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot update screen: date is null");\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Updating screen for date: " + date);\n        \n        // Retrieve existing records for this date\n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>());\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Found " + records.size() + " absence records for " + date);\n        \n        // In a real system, this would update the UI screen\n        // For simulation, we just return the records\n        return new ArrayList<>(records); // Return a copy to prevent modification\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Enters absence data for multiple students on a specific date.\n     * This simulates filling out the form and clicking "Save".\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the absence records\n     * @param studentRecords List of students with their attendance status\n     * @param notes Optional notes for the absence records (applied to all)\n     * @return List of created absence records\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if date or studentRecords is null\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> enterAbsenceData(LocalDate date, \n                                                List<StudentAttendance> studentRecords, \n                                                String notes) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to enter absence data");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Date cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        if (studentRecords == null || studentRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.warning("No student records provided for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Entering absence data for " + studentRecords.size() + \n                   " students on date: " + date);\n        \n        List<AbsenceRecord> newRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        String processedNotes = (notes == null) ? "" : notes.trim();\n        \n        for (StudentAttendance studentAttendance : studentRecords) {\n            if (studentAttendance == null || studentAttendance.getStudent() == null) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Skipping invalid student attendance record");\n                continue;\n            }\n            \n            Student student = studentAttendance.getStudent();\n            AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status = studentAttendance.getStatus();\n            \n            // Create absence record\n            AbsenceRecord record = new AbsenceRecord(date, student, status, processedNotes);\n            newRecords.add(record);\n            \n            LOGGER.fine("Created record: " + record.toSummaryString());\n        }\n        \n        // Store the records\n        storeAbsenceRecords(date, newRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Successfully entered " + newRecords.size() + \n                   " absence records for date: " + date);\n        \n        return newRecords;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends absence data to server and triggers email notifications for absent students.\n     * This simulates the server processing and email sending.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the absence records to send\n     * @return List of students for whom notifications were successfully sent\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public List<Student> sendDataToServer(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to send data to server");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Cannot send data to server: date is null");\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending absence data to server for date: " + date);\n        \n        // Get absence records for the specified date\n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.get(date);\n        if (records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absence records found for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        // Filter for absent students only\n        List<AbsenceRecord> absentRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (AbsenceRecord record : records) {\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                absentRecords.add(record);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (absentRecords.isEmpty()) {\n            LOGGER.info("No absent students found for date: " + date);\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Sending notifications for " + absentRecords.size() + " absent students");\n        \n        // Use EmailService to send notifications\n        List<Student> notifiedStudents = emailService.sendBulkAbsenceNotifications(absentRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Email notifications sent to " + notifiedStudents.size() + \n                   " parents for date: " + date);\n        \n        return notifiedStudents;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays updated log data after processing.\n     * This simulates refreshing the display with updated information.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to display log data for\n     * @return Formatted log data as a string\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if administrator is not logged in\n     */\n    public String displayUpdatedLogData(LocalDate date) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Administrator must be logged in to display log data");\n        }\n        \n        if (date == null) {\n            return "Error: Date is null";\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Displaying updated log data for date: " + date);\n        \n        List<AbsenceRecord> records = absenceRecordsByDate.get(date);\n        if (records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            return "No absence records found for " + date;\n        }\n        \n        StringBuilder logData = new StringBuilder();\n        logData.append("=== ABSENCE LOG FOR ").append(date).append(" ===\\n");\n        logData.append("Total records: ").append(records.size()).append("\\n\\n");\n        \n        int absentCount = 0;\n        int presentCount = 0;\n        int lateCount = 0;\n        \n        for (AbsenceRecord record : records) {\n            if (record.isAbsent()) {\n                absentCount++;\n            } else if (record.isPresent()) {\n                presentCount++;\n            } else if (record.isLate()) {\n                lateCount++;\n            }\n            \n            logData.append(record.toSummaryString()).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        logData.append("\\n=== SUMMARY ===\\n");\n        logData.append("Present: ").append(presentCount).append("\\n");\n        logData.append("Absent: ").append(absentCount).append("\\n");\n        logData.append("Late: ").append(lateCount).append("\\n");\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Log data displayed for " + records.size() + " records");\n        \n        return logData.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Interrupts the current operation and handles connection to SMOS server.\n     * This simulates the administrator interrupting the operation.\n     */\n    public void interruptOperation() {\n        LOGGER.warning("Administrator " + username + " interrupted the operation");\n        \n        // Handle interrupted SMOS server connection\n        if (isLoggedIn) {\n            LOGGER.info("Checking SMOS server connection status...");\n            boolean reconnected = emailService.connectToSmoSServer();\n            if (reconnected) {\n                LOGGER.info("Successfully reconnected to SMOS server after interruption");\n            } else {\n                LOGGER.warning("Could not reconnect to SMOS server. Emails may be queued.");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // In a real system, this would handle rollback or save state\n        LOGGER.info("Operation interrupted. System remains on registry screen.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the username of the administrator.\n     * \n     * @return The administrator username\n     */\n    public String getUsername() {\n        return username;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the email service instance used by this administrator.\n     * \n     * @return The EmailService instance\n     */\n    public EmailService getEmailService() {\n        return emailService;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date to retrieve records for\n     * @return List of absence records for the date, or empty list if none\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> getAbsenceRecordsForDate(LocalDate date) {\n        if (date == null) {\n            return new ArrayList<>();\n        }\n        return new ArrayList<>(absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>()));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all absence records across all dates.\n     * \n     * @return List of all absence records\n     */\n    public List<AbsenceRecord> getAllAbsenceRecords() {\n        List<AbsenceRecord> allRecords = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (List<AbsenceRecord> records : absenceRecordsByDate.values()) {\n            allRecords.addAll(records);\n        }\n        return allRecords;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all absence records (for testing/reset purposes).\n     */\n    public void clearAllRecords() {\n        LOGGER.info("Clearing all absence records");\n        absenceRecordsByDate.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Stores absence records for a specific date.\n     * \n     * @param date The date of the records\n     * @param records The records to store\n     */\n    private void storeAbsenceRecords(LocalDate date, List<AbsenceRecord> records) {\n        if (date == null || records == null || records.isEmpty()) {\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        // Get existing records for this date or create new list\n        List<AbsenceRecord> existingRecords = absenceRecordsByDate.getOrDefault(date, new ArrayList<>());\n        \n        // Remove any existing records for the same students (update in place)\n        for (AbsenceRecord newRecord : records) {\n            // Remove existing record for this student if present\n            existingRecords.removeIf(record -> \n                record.getStudent().getId().equals(newRecord.getStudent().getId()));\n            \n            // Add the new record\n            existingRecords.add(newRecord);\n        }\n        \n        // Store back in map\n        absenceRecordsByDate.put(date, existingRecords);\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Stored " + records.size() + " records for date: " + date);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class representing a student\'s attendance status for data entry.\n     * This is used when entering absence data through the form.\n     */\n    public static class StudentAttendance {\n        private Student student;\n        private AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status;\n        \n        /**\n         * Constructor for StudentAttendance.\n         * \n         * @param student The student\n         * @param status The attendance status\n         */\n        public StudentAttendance(Student student, null) {\n                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Attendance status cannot be null");\n            }\n            \n            this.student = student;\n            this.status = status;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Gets the student.\n         * \n         * @return The student\n         */\n        public Student getStudent() {\n            return student;\n        }\n  return status;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Sets the attendance status.\n         * \n         * @param status The new attendance status\n         */\n        public void setStatus(AbsenceRecord.AttendanceStatus status) {\n            if (status == null) {\n                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Attendance status cannot be null");\n            }\n            this.status = status;\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String toString() {\n            return "StudentAttendance[Student: " + student.getName() + \n                   ", Status: " + status.getDisplayName() + "]";\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'The Administrator class has been successfully created (it was generated by
